section.title: VDF Evidence Aggregation
section.t: When evidence chains span extended authorship sessions, the cumulative VDF proofs can become prohibitively large. This section defines a succinct aggregation mechanism.

section.title: Merkle-Sampled Proofs
section.t: Rather than requiring verification of every VDF proof in the chain, the Verifier MAY use Merkle-sampled audit proofs. The Attester constructs a Merkle tree over all VDF outputs in the chain and provides:

list.t: The Merkle root of all VDF outputs.
A random sample of k VDF proofs (where k is determined by the desired statistical confidence).
Merkle inclusion proofs for each sampled VDF output.

section.t: The Verifier checks the sampled VDF proofs and their Merkle inclusion, achieving probabilistic assurance over the entire chain with O(k log n) verification cost instead of O(n).
